query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

warnings.message: One of the fields on which a sort was requested does not exist

result.title: Validated mechanisms for ammonia/n-heptane at high pressure and high temperature
result.description: Update and validation of kinetic mechanisms for ammonia/n-heptane for the thermodynamic regime specific to marine engines with a focus on generated emissions

result.title: Simulation of NOx and N2O catalytic processes in the flue gas of the ammonia dual-fuel engine
result.description: Simulation and parametric study to examine the effect of catalyst formulation/loading/zoning, size, dimensions of the channels of the monolith, temperature and other parameters, providing input to the next tasks, particularly to the development of the N2O catalytic monolith

project.title: Resilience-centric Smart, Green, Networked EU Inland Waterways

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

programme.title: Clean, Safe and Accessible Transport and Mobility

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

programme.title: Climate resilient and environmentally sustainable transport infrastructure, with a focus on inland waterways

category.title: Topic
category.description: Programme: Part of the Commission work programme implementing legal basis

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

programme.title: Smart Mobility

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

result.title: Green Resilient IWT Digital Twin Generic application v1
result.description: Report on metrics and KPIs for the LL use cases using DT, Data Spaces, and ReNEW services and Solutions Deployed; Simulation Libraries, Simulated models at the level of Proof of Concept

project.title: Resilience-centric Smart, Green, Networked EU Inland Waterways

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.title: Impact assessment of COVID-19 recovery
result.description: A report on the emissions, energy system, technology, and macroeconomic implications of COVID-19 recovery packages, including an assessment of their optimal allocation for maximising emissions cuts and employment gains (Task 5.1).

result.title: Open data management plan
result.description: A report on the handling of research data during and after the end of the project; what data will be collected, processed and/or generated during the second modelling cycle; which methodology and standards will be applied; how data will be shared/made open access, and; how data will be curated and preserved (including after the end of the project) (Task 3.1).

project.title: Textile Recycling EXcellence

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

programme.title: Increasing the circularity in textiles, plastics and/or electronics value chains

category.title: Topic
category.description: Programme: Part of the Commission work programme implementing legal basis

result.title: Specifying and testing how externalities and disservices can be included in accounts
result.description: Report that examines how externalities and disservices can be included in ecosystem accounts. This is one of the outstanding issues in SEEA Ecosystem Accounting, but highly relevant to connect accounts to among others the work of IPBES. The report will specify options, identify a preferred option, and will provide examples for specific services in the SELINA case study sites.
